qas.question: What topic did Paul VI see as the most important to the church counsel?
Who did Paul VI feel was most important in the Catholic Hierarchy?
What did the American Counsel of Bishops rally for?
What Saint did Paul VI denote as mother of the Catholic church?
In what year did Paul VI formally appoint Mary as mother of the Catholic church?

context: Paul VI opened the third period on 14 September 1964, telling the Council Fathers that he viewed the text about the <a0_0>Church<a0_0/> as the most important document to come out from the Council. As the Council discussed the role of bishops in the <a1_0>papacy<a1_0/>, Paul VI issued an explanatory note confirming the primacy of the papacy, a step which was viewed by some as meddling in the affairs of the Council American bishops pushed for a speedy resolution on <a2_0>religious freedom<a2_0/>, but Paul VI insisted this to be approved together with related texts such as ecumenism. The Pope concluded the session on 21 November <a4_0>1964<a4_0/>, with the formal pronouncement of <a3_0>Mary<a3_0/> as Mother of the Church.
